objtitle.title: *Epitome of James Hervey's "Meditations Among the Tombs"*

objinfo.leafsize: 43.1 x 29.2 cm.The leaf was probably trimmed to its present dimensions at some point in its history.
objinfo.pennednumbers: noneThe work is signed "W Blake inv &" lower left. This inscription apparently continues, possibly with a date, but the right portion of the inscription is obscured and partly cut off by the trimming of the lower border of the work.

provenance.name: Tate Collection
provenance.note: Acquired at an unknown time by Thomas Butts, probably directly from Blake shortly after the work was finished; by inheritance to Thomas Butts, Jr., in 1845; sold from the Butts collection, Foster and Son auction, London, 29 June 1853, lot 135, titled "One from Hervey's Meditations" (£2.10s. to "Money," probably a code for a dealer); G. T. Saul; given by Saul to the National Gallery, London, in 1878; transferred to the Tate Gallery (now Tate Collection) in 1909.
